Fields.DialogueText: Miss, as you can see, we have no room to play a game of cards.
That's dreadful!
If we can't have fun on this ship... well, you can imagine what that feels like.
It feels like work!
Zdravstvuyte, Kapitan!
Fear not, Captain, I am headed back to work!

Fields.MenuText: It's not terrible...
It's a travesty!
I have no idea what you are talking about.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes it is! The crew feel like they have no place to have fun, to express themselves!
I am glad you are on our side! All we do is work around here. We never have any fun, it seems!
The crew don't have a place to have fun. We need to make them a place.
What do you mean we don't have any fun? Didn't we trot around the globe to make toffee?

Fields.MenuText: You do the least amount of work out of anyone in this submarine.
Stop twisting my arm, and I'll give you a vacation.

Fields.DialogueText: That's not true! I made toffee, didn't I?
Ura! I love a vacation. Let's go somewhere that has lots of candy!
*ALARM*
Not fair! The work never seems to end.
Why was he so quick to leave? Is it terrible, Kapitan?
Yes, but how far did that get us? URG! I feel like all I do is work around here. I need a vacation!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I hope it's about cleaning and taking responsibility around here.
About a vacation?
I know what you are thinking, and I will not allow a cow on this ship.

Fields.DialogueText: Responsibility? That's for old people.
I thought about a vacation, but the crew keeps saying that the Morganas will not rest if we take a vacation. They want something inside the ship.
I almost forgot about that cow, Spasibo, Kapitan!

Fields.MenuText: That's what the accommodations are for...
I'm listening...

Fields.DialogueText: They told me it's too crowded in there. They need more room.
Everything is so crowded in this submarine, but the crew needs more room.
The crew is starting to get claustrophobic in here. They tell me that I need to open some space up.
*ALARM*
BAH! This will interfere with my train of thought.
Write it down before you forget.
@BATTLE
I've been talking with the crew, Kapitan.
The crew decided that they want a place to play games and lounge around. Rest and relax, almost like a vacation inside this vessel.
What are you looking for, S-3?
I am trying to find a good place where the crew can stretch out a bit, but I am having trouble.
Things are packed tight on a submarine.

Fields.MenuText: Nowhere. They already have their bunks for rest and recreation.
Try the engine room.
If they need space, they can do it on land. In port.

Fields.DialogueText: There's not enough space in that room. The beds are too tiny for many of them.
It's too noisy in there. They can't play a game of cards over twin naturally aspirated diesel engines.
Who knows how long that will be when we get to port! It's been so long, I can't remember the last time we were there!
All this thinking has made me hungry. I'm going to look for a slice of baklava. Or maybe a pastry...
That's a good idea... the galley.
@BATTLE
Do you have any suggestions, Kapitan?
*ALARM*
Now I must fight while I am hungry. That is no fun, Kapitan.
What is all that noise?

Fields.MenuText: You? Cleaning? What type of medication are you taking?
Something smells fishy here. You never clean.
Come clean with it. What are you trying to hide?!

Fields.DialogueText: Medication? Isn't that what old people call candy?
I need to help the crew. Their cabin fever is running hotter by the minute.
I'm not trying to hide anything, Kapitan. Why can't I clean up?
Don't be a bully, Kapitan. I am cleaning out this room to make more space for the crew.
For what?
I will make this a new game room. Think of how much extra space we will have when I clear this out.
*ALARM*
We'll talk about it after we take care of the Morganas...
Then you like the idea? I knew you would. You are not a bully after all!
Now you're the one twisting my arm.
@BATTLE
Kapitan! I am cleaning out the galley.
Is this truly necessary?
Of course it is, Kapitan. Seeing my crew happy will make me happy.
Clearing out the galley, though...
Where is the crew going to eat?
In their bunks. It will be very simple that way.
What about preparing their meals?
All we really need is candy. You don't have to prepare candy once it's made. Just stow it in your chest or locker.

Fields.MenuText: People can't live on candy alone.
What if we are at sea for a long time?
Fine. At least it's not a cow.

Fields.DialogueText: They can find heartier meals in port.
Then we will just need more candy. Things are more simple this way. The simpler they are, the less likely they are to break.
Thanks for reminding me, I almost forgot about that cow!
Imagine this. Without a galley, there is less to break on my ship. We can keep things more simple AND the crew will be happy. No one loses in this situation.
Oh, I'm so excited that I could do a victory dance now!
*ALARM*
Oops. I've spoken too soon.
@BATTLE
Don't frown like that, Kapitan. Just imagine how much more simple the ship will be without a galley! There will be far fewer cutlery-related injuries.
*CLANK*
*CRASH*
All that noise... I thought someone was scuttling the ship! What is going on in here, S-3?

Fields.MenuText: There goes all our storage space...
It's not as if anyone is organized around here anyway.
I'll miss being able to make a meal.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't fret, Kapitan. We can still put things on the floor. I like seeing where everything is anyway.
Organization is such a subjective term.
With no galley, it's less work! No longer will sailors have to waste time cleaning dishes.
Ooo, what is that rolling across the floor?
It's a vodka bottle.
Vodka. Why do people drink this stuff? It is not sweet at all.
Some people mix it with cream and cocoa powder for a sweeter drink.
That's similar to that eggnog drink! But without raw eggs.
I think I have some milk left over from the toffee...
That might not be a good idea.
Decisions, decisions. Do I want to use the milk for toffee, or to make this sweet drink you won't stop talking about?
Hee-hee, I'm removing the cabinets. This room is cramped. Taking out the cabinets will give us more room.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
We could have just replaced the cabinet doors...
*giggle*
What's so funny?
Hee-hee, that vodka-cream drink you suggested is very good! I like it verrrrrrrrry much.
You're walking a bit funny...
WHEEE!

Fields.MenuText: I think you've had too much to drink.
You should drink more. Clearly you've lost your sea legs.
Give me that mug!

Fields.DialogueText: Nyet, I've never heard such an expression.
Will drinking more help me find them?
Don't take it away from me, please!
Who could imagine that alcohol that smells like floor cleaner can taste sweet?
It's not sweet. You mix it into sweet things, like cream.
*ALARM*
You stay here.
And miss out on everything? Nyet!
Clearly, you're not ready for battle.
Just help me find some sea legs so I can fight, too.
@BATTLE
Oh, are we diving? The floor is tilting.
Urrrggg, my head! Kapitan, I am dying.
You had too much fun last night.
That drink was sweet. You know me and sweets - once I get a taste for it, I am like a shark.
Drink more water.

Fields.MenuText: Water doesn't have any taste.
I also hate the taste of water. Let's just drink milk or juice.
Water helps your headache go away faster. You are dehydrated.

Fields.DialogueText: What well do you drink from? Every well I drink from has a different taste to it.
I could drink either of those all day long! I hope my head won't hurt after drinking them.
Do we have any kompot on board? I would rather drink kompot.
Is this what happens every time you drink?
Only when you go overboard with it.
How do I know when to stop?
*ALARM*
OOWWW!! Why is that alarm so loud?
It will be even louder in battle.
Can't we use suppressors?
@BATTLE
I don't like the taste of water. It is boring and not sweet.
Urgh... what's going on? My head hurts...
Weren't you *just* complaining about having a hangover?
O verno!
How did you *forget* you were hung over?
You know, Kapitan, it's the darnedest thing...
My memory's so bad... sometimes I can forget... things are happening... *while* they're happening to me.
You've got to be kidding me.
Da, vereno... it's true. Sometimes I ...
I will be hungry or thirsty or sleepy, and then I'll find something fun to do, and six hours later, I'll wonder why I'm starving and parched and exhausted.

Fields.MenuText: So you lose track of time?
You can't just ignore a hangover.
I think everyone does that, but this is a bit further than that.

Fields.DialogueText: I lose track of *everything*.
I can ignore anything that's not fun! ...ow.
Is it really that strange? ....Ew, turn off the light.
...You are a *talented* girl.
I am the world champion of forgetting things. ... And making candy.
*ALARM*
... whyyyyy...
You're hung over, remember? Come on - let's make you the world champion of fighting Morganas.
Nnng. I'm coming, Kapitan... Just... five more minutes.
@BATTLE
Wow! So much of this room is cleared out already...
It opens things up when you do not have cabinets in the way.
Now, if only there was something we could do about this drab color. So melancholy to look at.
Then you have all these scuffs on the walls from taking the cabinets out.
Eww, repairing that wall is work!
How is painting a room bright colors not work, but repairing a crack or a scape is?
What draws the line between work and not work?

Fields.MenuText: This makes absolutely no sense.
That is a big difference between the two.
I'm not sure how to respond. I wish I had some candy to give to you.

Fields.DialogueText: It makes PERFECT sense. One is work, the other is not.
I'm happy you see things my way, Kapitan!
Oooh, what kind of candy do you have? Wait, you've been hiding candy from me?!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
One is giving my vessel a new face! One that better represents me, and that's not work. But repairing this drab, depressing colors, well, that is work.
There, isn't that cute!
This is a picture of a bear cub...
It brightens the place up, don't you think?
What's under this picture?
A hole!?
Just an interior wall hole. It isn't anything important.
How did it get there?

Fields.MenuText: The bear cub photograph brightens the place up.
Find someone to fix this hole!
I like the hole. I can use it as a hiding place for candy.

Fields.DialogueText: It's superior to looking at a hole, and it breaks up the monochromatic military color scheme.
I asked, but nobody wanted to. I don't want to push their buttons.
KAPIITAAAANNN! Please don't hide candy from me!
*ALARM*
You should put a picture of a Morgana over the hole.
That's not cute!
@BATTLE
Maybe one of the sailors punched the wall in a fit of steel-shattering fury.
*RUMBLE* UURRGG, I think that's my tummy.

Fields.MenuText: Yes, but I'm not sharing with you.
No. You removed the galley for the sake of simplicity, remember?
I don't have any food, but let me know if you find some. I'm also hungry.

Fields.DialogueText: Please? I'm so hungry right now.
Yes, but now I'm hungry. Someone must have food somewhere.
There must be something to eat around here.
Maybe the sailors are hiding candy in their lockers.
Don't steal from your crew.
I don't want to eat all the candy I am saving. I'm trying to make it last!
*ALARM*
You still have candy?
Hello? S-3?
@BATTLE
All this work has made me hungry. Do you have anything to eat, Kapitan?
Are you regretting tearing out the galley for a game room?
Of course not! Who wants to scour pots?
What are you going to do for food?

Fields.MenuText: Yes, that was me.
No, that must have been someone else.
The hole is still there?! Why am I still surprised at this point?

Fields.DialogueText: I thought it was you. Sometimes things just blur together, and it's hard to keep track.
Hmmm... Things must have blurred together. Must have been one of the sailors.
That's a good question. I hope you're not getting cabin fever in here.
Oh, look!
Who put a sandwich in the wall? Surely someone trying to hide it.
Finders keepers!
*munch* Things taste so good when you're hungry.
*ALARM*
Maybe you could share that sandwich?
@BATTLE
Didn't you suggest about caching candy behind that bear cub picture?
I'm back with food, Captain.
Well done. I think S-3 is ravenous with hunger.
Excuse me!
Ooff!
FOOOOD!
Settle down. Give the officer some room to breathe.
I'm just so hungry! What do you have here?
MUFFINS!

Fields.MenuText: Muffins? Yuck, I hate muffins.
Don't eat them all. Save me one.
Oh look, the officer brought bread.

Fields.DialogueText: Less for you is more for me!
Here. Better take this now, before I forget, Kapitan.
You can have that. I'm happy with my muffins.
*ALARM*
Let me finish my muffin!
@BATTLE
Please don't chew off my leg. I'm not a muffin.
Just lower it down!
Keep going!
It's too big. I don't think your hatch is wide enough.
What on Earth are you trying to fit through the hatch?
A table, for our game room.
I think it's too wide.

Fields.MenuText: It would have been easier if the galley was left alone.
Don't force the table in! Even if you get it in the hatch, you must move it through narrow corridors.
Is that MY table? How did you get my table out here?

Fields.DialogueText: Nyet. Who was happy scouring dishes? The crew wanted a place to play games. Besides, it's much more fun this way.
I wish we had a folding table, but they aren't just big enough to accommodate everyone.
No wonder we didn't have to pay anything for it. Spasibo, Kapitan. You're a helper!
*ALARM*
Leave the table on the dock for now.
Yes, Miss.
Good. I didn't like that table anyway.
@BATTLE
I think you're right, sailor. There needs to be an easier solution to this problem.
What's going on?
We had trouble fitting the tables in through the narrow hatch. Now we have a corridor to deal with.
It's simpler if we bring in the building materials and construct the tables in the room.
Besides, now everyone can help out and feel like they've contributed. *rumble*
Is that your stomach again?
This work makes me so hungry! Luckily, I came prepared.
You keep a muffin in your top?
Is this not a reasonable place to keep muffins? Who is going to steal it?
See, Kapitan, the lack of a galley keeps things more simple around here. Everything can work like a well-greased cog.

Fields.MenuText: The Americans have the right idea.
I don't understand Americans at all.
You're just making excuses to avoid cleaning.

Fields.DialogueText: I can't fathom how much time they spend cleaning everything. It seems like a waste to me. If things are perpetually greasy, they are more simple.
For a moment there, I thought I was the only one!
I am not! There's no sense to clean something if it will get dirty again.
*ALARM*
See? My greasy gears in the torpedo launchers won't jam or seize.
I think it's because it's still manual.
Either way - the more simple something is, the better off we are.
@BATTLE
I don't understand why the Americans need to keep everything so clean. If things stay greasy, it's easier.
*CRASH*
I nearly killed myself tripping on all this! Why are these fuel cans out?
Those are not fuel cans, Kapitan. They are paint cans.
Paint cans?
Da! I might not be able to paint the walls bright, cheery colors, but I can paint the table and chairs. They're not regulation, so I'm free to express myself as I please.
There are a lot of colors here.
I couldn't decide on just one or two.
How are all these colors going to work?
Polka dots! Miss America wore a polka dot swimming suit in 1926. I wasn't born yet, but that's what the older Comrades of the Fleet tell me.

Fields.MenuText: Stripes are better. Polka dots aren't a good match for sailors.
This is an excellent idea.
I have a feeling something bad is going to come from this.

Fields.DialogueText: Why not? If it makes me happy, it will surely make my crew happy.
It makes me so happy that I can finally have some bright colors in this place!
Don't be so negative, Kapitan. It dampens my mood.
*ALARM*
Perfect timing.
Excuse me?
With the vibrations from the battle, I won't have to stir the paint.
@BATTLE
Even Minnie Mouse wears polka dots! They put a smile on my face.
Everything's simpler this way!
Look at how beautiful this room is now!

Fields.MenuText: I don't care.
I'd put it in your cabin and get rid of it when we hit port. Out of sight, out of mind.
Keep it in the game room. That is the safest place to store paint.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmmmm... I guess wherever I put it doesn't matter, then.
That's a good idea, Kapitan... but things that go into my room disappear without a trace.
Why is that considered a safe place?
I think I'll just store this paint in the engine room.
What about the fumes?
Not to worry, Kapitan. There are enough heavy metals in this paint to keep the combustion point high... I think?
You want a paint with high chromium content, especially in a marine setting, to avoid corrosion. Look at these beautiful colors it creates.
I think it might be hazardous to your health.
Let me go put these paint cans in the engine room. I'll be right back.
@BATTLE
There seems to be some leftover paint. What should I do with it, Kapitan?
*ALARM*
Now, why was I here in the engine room? I think I needed to find something.
Oh, yes, it was to drink this bottle of spiced rum. Hee-hee!
I'd better go back to check on the Kapitan.
What's this?
Oh, the paint! That's right, I was supposed to store the paint in a safe spot.
I think it was the battery. Let me to take this paint over there.
WHOOOPS! I think I've had too much to drink. Hee hee.
@BATTLE
S-3, you haven't put that paint up yet?

Fields.MenuText: See that it's put away.
Have you been drinking?
Something isn't right... did you style your hair?

Fields.DialogueText: Da, Kapitan.
Maaayyybeee, hee-hee.
I think I put a new bow in it today, or was that just a dream?
Hmmm... where was I going to put it? Oh, these tubes! No one will ever see the paint in here.
There, that wasn't so bad!
Hmmmm, I wonder if any of the crew members have any toffee they don't have an immediate use for.
I'm on my way, Kapitan. I was distracted by the battle.
*ALARM*
Just get it done, S-3.
What is going on here?
Looking through the periscope now, Captain. It appears that the torpedo launchers were full of something. The sea is turning bright colors.
Let me have a look.
Hey, that's the paint Miss S-3 used.
How did it end up there?
I do not know, Captain.
Uh-oh!
Did you put the paint in the torpedo launchers?
I put the paint somewhere, but I do not remember exactly where, Kapitan.
The engine room reports there is no paint back there, Captain.
You put the paint in the torpedo launchers! Look what happened!

Fields.MenuText: I suppose it does...
I guess that's what paint factories do. Dump the paint into the water supply.
I think this might cause an environmental hazard.

Fields.DialogueText: See, everything worked out for the best.
You don't think it will cause any harm, do you?
What? Is the paint going to hurt the fish?
Awww. Just when I was enjoying myself, the colors got washed away...
@BATTLE
The sea looks more bright and colorful now.
I hope it dilutes quickly, before other ships can see this.
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: I miss the galley.
This is much better.
I'm glad it's not a bar. Your tipsy giggling sends too many sailors into a scuttle.

Fields.DialogueText: But this is MUCH more fun, Kapitan!
Isn't it? The bright colors alone are worth that extra work.
They're going to send this submarine into a scuttle?! I hope it's not while I'm inside.
I think it's time for a game!
What's that?
We need a few decks of cards.
Are we playing poker?
Nooo, that's far too complicated, too many rules. We should play something simple, like Go Fish.
I was hoping for poker...
*ALARM*
I'll notify everyone during battle that we are playing Go Fish! Make sure to bring your candy.
@BATTLE
Hooray! The game room is finished! It is very colorful, bright, and fun!
Listen up, everyone! I asked you to bring toffee.
Now, we can't use money because some grownups in the Motherland don't want us to have any fun. Toffee is better than money anyways...
The current pot is 3 pieces. Winner gets the purse.
Yes, Miss!
Officer, do you have any nines?
Go fish.
Drat!
S-3, do you have any fours?
Here you are!
Captain, do you have any twos?
Go fish.
It's still early on in the game. This is only the first round.
Kapitan, do you have any eights?
Go fish.

Fields.MenuText: I regret this not being poker.
This game is pretty fun.
I won't admit to it, but this sure beats scouring pots.

Fields.DialogueText: This is much more fun! It's simple enough that ANYONE can play!
Go Fish is one of my favorite card games!
Did you say something, Kapitan?
*ALARM*
Looks like we will have to finish this card game another time.
No cheating while everyone is away!
@BATTLE
Bah!
It's not fair! I lost some of my toffee in that game!
That's how card games are. You win some, you lose some.
Now what will I do? I only have two hundred pieces left.
Two hundred?!

Fields.MenuText: How do you stay so thin?
To be young again!
Be careful. You might get diabetes.

Fields.DialogueText: I do not know. I only know what it is like to be young. Maybe it is my youth.
I love it so much! I don't want to get old. That would make me very sad.
I love sugar. Why would this be a problem?
Only three days of toffee left... I hope we are able to dock in port soon. I need to get more.
Toffee, baklava, muffins, I want it all!
Da! I am craving sweets right now! --Though at this point I'd settle for bread.
*ALARM*
This is good. If I wait to have toffee AFTER the battle, my supply will last longer.
@BATTLE
Da. That will only last me three days - but I will have to eat it slowly.
KAAPIITAAANNNN!
My toffee rations are dwindling!

Fields.MenuText: I think toffee was the least of their worries.
Yes, surely this was EXACTLY how they felt.
Toffee is for westerners. You should eat bread and drink kompot.

Fields.DialogueText: But toffee brings joy. Without toffee, I would be full of melancholy and sorrow.
It is no wonder the people from that era are jaded and depressing.
I like kompot. It is much better than water. Water is boring.
There is only one solution to my problem.
Oh no... is it the...
A COW!
Yep, it is.
A cute, tiny, itty-bitty cow. Just a small one, because a big one will not fit through the hatch.
I'm surprised you haven't thought up a goat.
What do you mean?
Murciana dairy goats are much smaller than cows and are faster to mature.
You are saying you will get me a goat? Zdorovo!
I didn't say that!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Is this what people felt like during the revolutions in the Motherland?
What's wrong, Miss S-3?
The Kapitan says that I cannot have a cow or a goat because there is no more room. I am very sad because of this.
But, First Comrade, you made more room.
What do you mean?
When you removed the galley and made a game room, you made more space.
You're right! We do have more room!
Did you hear that, Kapitan? We do have room for a goat! Or maybe a small cow, a very small one.
Sailor, why are you putting ideas into her head?
Kapitan, we do have room now. Don't you think an itty-bitty cow could fit in here?
Where are we storing the hay?

Fields.MenuText: I'm not going to win, am I?
No!
We'll talk about it later...

Fields.DialogueText: I NEED the milk for toffee! Think of all the bows I could put on her cute head with her tiny ears!
Really, Kapitan?! I promise I'll take care of her. You know how much of a hard worker I am!

Fields.MenuText: I have a feeling that I'll wind up taking care of this animal...
How is she so tenacious at this, but putting her underwear in the laundry is like pulling teeth?

Fields.DialogueText: I'll help, don't worry!
If underwear is in the middle of the floor, it is dirty. If underwear is in the pile of clean clothes in the corner, then they are clean. It is a simple system.
Awww... even after all that?
We can use it as mattresses in the bunks!
And a goat will eat either one, probably.
Oh! We are getting a goat for sure then! Spasibo, Kapitan! Spasibo! We can name her "Toffee" and you will love her!
*sigh*
